content: needle through the back loop knit the 3 stitches from the cable needle through the back loop c3rtbl - cable 3 right through the back loop slip the next 2 stitches to a cable needle and hold in front knit the next stich from the left needle through the back loop slip the purl stitch back onto the left needle and knit knit the next stitch from the cable needle through the back loop c3ltbl - cable 3 left through the back loop slip the next 2 stitches to a cable needle and hold in back knit the next stich from the left needle through the back loop slip the purl stitch back onto the left needle and knit knit the next stitch from the cable needle through the back loop *-* - repeat repeat instructions between asterisks cuffs using smaller needles cast on 40 44 48 52 sts *k1tbl p1* until end repeat 1x1 twisted rib for 10 12 14 16 row set up for the right mitten if you prefer to use dpns or short circulars place your bor marker after the first 22 24 26 28 sts to mark the side if you prefer to use magic loop place the first 22 24 26 28 sts top of the mitten st on the first needle and the other 18 20 22 24 palm sts on the second needle for the left mitten if you prefer to use dpns or short circulars place your bor marker after the first 18 20 24 sts to mark the side if you prefer to use magic loop place the first 18 20 22 24 sts palm sts on the first needle and the other 22 24 26 28 sts on the second needle mitten body and thumb increases using larger needles work the chart as written - each mitten size has a separate chart for each mitten so make sure you re using the right one thumb increases start row 13 15 17 17 or at the base of the thumb increase 2 stitches every 3 row on the chart you may want to place stitch markers on either side of your thumb stitches in order to isolate them use your preferred method of increasing although i find that picking up the right leg of stitch below creates a seamless stitch and doesn t leave a hole on round 33 35 37 37 knit the first part of the mitten then place the 14 thumb stitches on a piece of scrap yarn or stitch holderbefore knitting the second part of the mitten convertible set up optional if you prefer a convertible mitten follow the instructions below if not ignore them and carry on to the decreases the convertible set up begins on row 44 46 48 48 or at the base of the fingers right mitten - work the first 22 24 26 28 sts to get to the palms sts left mitten - the palm sts are at the start
